newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso ends shade down on rate cut.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso ends shade down on rate cut.

text.p: * Central Bank leaves market on its own after rate cut
The Philippine peso ended a shade down at 26.368 on Thursday from 26.366 following the 25 basis point cut in the Central Bank's overnight borrowing rate to 11.25 percent, traders said.
The day's average was at 26.37 from 26.365, with volume down to $107.5 million from $157.5 million.
"It (the Central Bank) brought down its overnignt rate because there's less pressure on the peso," said a dealer.
The Central Bank had raised its overnight borrowing on Monday by 50 basis points to quell peso speculation brought on by fears of capital flight from stock market sales.
Though the peso slightly weakened from Thursday's rate cut, it did not veer towards its recent low of 26.375.
The rate cut had not been enough to encourage banks to drive the peso sharply lower, one dealer said. The Central Bank did not intervene in the market.
The peso might dip further on Friday due to arbitrage play for the coming weekend, they added.
